description:
'''Rickie Lee Skaggs''' (born July 18, 1954), known professionally as '''Ricky Skaggs''', is an American [[neotraditional country]] and [[bluegrass music|bluegrass]] singer, musician, producer, and [[composer]]. He primarily plays [[mandolin]]; however, he also plays [[fiddle]], guitar, [[mandocaster]], and [[banjo]].

Skaggs was inducted into the [[Musicians Hall of Fame and Museum]] in 2016 and both the [[International Bluegrass Music Hall of Fame]] and the [[Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum|Country Music Hall of Fame]] in 2018. On January 13, 2021, it was announced Skaggs had been awarded the [[National Medal of Arts]] by [[President of the United States|President]] [[Donald Trump]], alongside fellow country musician [[Toby Keith]].
